Authors:
Gabriela Celeste Gonzalez, Jorge Ariel Marfetan, Francisco
Kuhar
Title: Phylogenetic position of dry-gasteroid Patagonian fungi
Abstract:
Recent efforts focused on sequestrate patagonian fungi,
resulted in studies that are completing the knowledge of the
biogeography and phylogeny of many secotioid or gasteroid
ectomycorrhizal species. Dry gasteroids from Patagonia, in turn, were
not studied in depth in the molecular era. They constitute a different
morpho ecological group with anemocoric spore dispersal and without
known mutualistic association with plants. These features suggest that
their biogeography must be different in terms of dispersal abilities and
lack of co-occurrence with tree hosts. The aim of this work is to sketch
a preliminary filiation of some records made in central Patagonia,
providing accurately identified vouchers associated to molecular
markers. Based on these results and previous records, morpho anatomical
traits are evaluated as well as their similarities and possible
conspecificity with close taxa from far locations. The biology of this
morpho ecological group is briefly compared with the ectomycorrhizal
gasteroid fungi. As a result of this research, the importance of the
study of historic collections seem to be of paramount importance when
trying to discern recent species introduction in this group.
